Why You Should Watch Gravity Falls (No, seriously.)

Posted June 23rd, 2019
          
          Date updated goes here: 
          dayst nd rd, 2019

I initially didn't care to watch Gravity Falls. I had seen a few commercials for it and, shamefully, thought to myself why would I watch a dumb kids show? Which, looking back on it, seems a bit strange considering I love Adventure Time. But in any case, as soon as I had decided not to watch it, I was suddenly surrounded by it. Wherever I went on the internet, I would see a gif or a passing comment or something tangentially related to this show. And the next thing I knew, I had binged all of season one within a week.

What is Gravity Falls, you ask? It's a cartoon created by Alex Hirsch about 12-year old twins Dipper and Mabel Pines who travel to Gravity Falls, Oregon to spend time with their Great Uncle, or Grunkle Stan, for the summer. We get to meet the citizens of the town over the course of the show and, of course, hijinks ensue. And who doesn't love hijinks?

Allow me to take a moment to explain why you should watch one of my favourite shows.

The Plot

Here's a spoiler-free introduction to the plot: Dipper finds a mysterious journal in the woods written by an unknown author who writes that Gravity Falls is a weird town full of mysteries. Dipper becomes determined to find The Author and solve some mysteries of his own, but the The Author has written to trust no one.

The Gravity Falls fandom has developed a collective reputation of being super sleuths. The foreshadowing in this show is intense, and there are major plot clues hidden in plain sight. When the show was airing, fans were always discussing theories and possible plot lines. And when thousands of theorists come together, some ideas are bound to be right.

Cryptograms and Ciphers

Perhaps one of the most intriguing aspects of the show is the use of cryptograms and ciphers. That backwards and non-sensical text you see for one second on screen? Yeah, that might be a plot point. A character says something that sounds like complete gibberish? They're probably saying it backwards and it's entirely possible that it's crucial information. On the other hand, part of GF's charm is that it's fun so these codes and messages might be just that - for fun.

The Characters

I will say right now that my fave character in this show is Grunkle Stan spoilers kinda not really. I can't really choose between the twinsand why would you want to?

What's great about these characters is that they're not perfect. They have flaws and they make mistakes, but the important thing is that they learn from their mistakes. It's satisfying to watch these characters grow over the course of two seasons.

And I suppose part of the reason why fans love the characters is because their interactions are grounded in reality. Here's an excerpt from the creator on the stories and relationships in the show:

There's a balance of ingredients every episode has to have. But every episode must have that element, and I think a lot of the most successful moments of the show are the ones where the character relationship, the ones that I thought I was being the most personal and being the most referencing my own specific life, often wound up feeling the most universal.

Alex Hirsch for Vox, August 1st, 2014

The Art

Not to be dramatic, but I just really love the art direction in this show. Like, mystical, spooky, whatever it is - you know it looks amazing. I have a bunch of stills from the show as rotating wallpapers on my laptop.

I'm going to lump music under this section because, really, the music in this show is an art form. Brad Breeck has composed a wonderful score for this show. It can be fun in one moment and heart-wrenching in the next. I hear the music in this show and I just wanna... learn these songs on the piano, and I can barely play the piano. And who doesn't love that iconic theme song.

Watch the Show (No, seriously)

I've watched Gravity Falls multiple times now. What starts off as hey, let me watch one of my fave episodes quickly turns into whoops I've just watched an entire season instead of studying for exams. It happens, but with good reason. It's really just a great show: funny, charming, and full of heart.

And to summarize why you should watch this awesome show:

  1. Awesome plot
  2. Awesome characters
  3. Awesome art
